text:
(1)
South Street, west side, at Old Slip, as seen from Pier No. 9, East River.
April 14, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; and showing a view further northward.
April 14, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, showing a closer view. The prominent buildings appearing from left to right are the Farmer's Loan and Trust Co. and the Bank of Manhattan Co. In the foreground (5-story white house) is seen the United States Assay Office.
October 29, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip
East River - Shore and skyline of lower Manhattan - South Ferry - Williamsburg Bridge - Guylers Alley - Old Slip.
East River - Shore and skyline of lower Manhattan - South Ferry - Williamsburg Bridge - Guylers Alley - Old Slip.

text:
(1)
East River, river scene, showing barges of scrap iron off South Street near pier 9, at the foot of Old Slip. In the background is visible the shore of Brooklyn.

April 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A similar view. Also shown is the American Sugar Refining Building (120 Wall Street) and the tug "Cumco."

P. L. Sperr.

October 1, 1934.
title: East River - River scenes - Pier 9 - [American Sugar Refining Company.]
